message: As Chairman of the Committee on House Administration, I had the honor to serve as a teller, tallying the votes for Speaker Paul Ryan's reelection!
Today I was sworn in as a Member of the 115th Congress. Looking forward to enacting real change to find #ABetterWay for a #ConfidentAmerica!
NA

Great seeing Vice President-elect @mike.pence at Conference this morning. He is one of the finest people I've met and I encourage everyone to pray for Mike and for the new @realdonaldtrump Administration.

Thank you SuperTalk Mississippi for having me on this morning. It's always such an honor.  In case you missed it, you can catch up online at this link below (around 8 minutes in): http://www.supertalk.fm/archives/audio-archives/gallo-archives/?recording_id=21007  ---

The decision by President Donald J. Trump to move forward with the Keystone and Dakota Access pipelines is going to put American Energy Affordability first and will create jobs! I am excited to work with a president that will put American jobs and security first.

Today I introduced H.R. 633, the Patient Fairness and Relief Act of 2017. This bill will allow our hard-working Mississippians and Americans to keep the health insurance policies that they had before Obamacare, like they were falsely promised by the Obama Administration. It will help to avoid cancellations, premium rate increases, and is a step towards undoing the damage done by Obamacare, which is collapsing under its own weight.

This week I joined my fellow Lawmakers in Philadelphia to come together to develop the priorities for the upcoming Congress. I am looking forward to a very productive year as we enact bold reforms to create a better way for a #ConfidentAmerica.
Proud to speak at the Eagle Scout Court of Honor for Troop 8 at FBC Jackson. Congratulations to Will Jones, Kennedy Guest, John William Ables, John Clarke Altman.
Today I participated in a hearing on the future of self-driving cars. These innovations could have a huge impact on the lives of those with disabilities. Watch the video of my line of questioning:
Today I met with the student leaders from Ole Miss and Mississippi State. These young men and women are going to do great things for our state!

This morning, for the National Fragile X Foundation Advocacy Day, passionate advocates and loving families from across the country came to D.C. to make a difference and to raise awareness of this disability.

Today my son Livingston had the opportunity to meet the Vice President of the United States. A huge thank you to my friend @mike.pence for taking the time to make this happen.

Sidney and I had a great tour of Rivers Plant Farm south of Brandon with Willie, Glenda, Rhonda and Bill Rivers! Amazing!

Congressman Gregg Harper (R-Miss.) hosts his annual Military Academy Day, honoring this year's nominees and appointees from the state of Mississippi, and providing students and families of students with information on the nomination and appointment process for the various military academies across the country.

This Saturday, I had the honor of hosting my annual Military Academy Day in honor of the 2017 military academy nominees and appointees from across our great state and to give potential nominees and their families the opportunity to learn more about the process and to hear from great speakers about their incredible experiences with the academies.   Check out the pictures from the event, and visit my website at harper.house.gov for more information on the military academy nomination process!
It was an honor to meet with these young leaders this morning.

I want to say congratulations to John Gionfriddo on his graduation from the Mason LIFE Program at George Mason University. John was an incredible CIPIID intern for Congressman David G. Valadao, one of the most active participants in the CIPIID program.   Congratulations John and best of luck on all your future endeavors!
Always great to see my good friend Dr. Sampat Shivangi! Thank you Sampat for inviting me to come speak to the American Association of Physicians of Indian Origin this afternoon.

What a privilege to speak at the Trail of Honor Opening Ceremony at Harley-Davidson on I-55 South!  Make sure you go visit between now and Monday.  What an honor to visit with Marine Corps Medal of Honor recipient Woody Williams (standing).  Woody is one of only six living WWII Medal of Honor recipients, and the only living Medal of Honor recipient from the Battle of Iwo Jima.   Medal of Honor recipient Ronald Rosser (seated) received his medal for his heroic feats during the Korean War. Ronald also lost a brother in the Korean War and a brother in the Vietnam War. He is one of only six living Korean War recipients of the Medal of Honor.

In Case You Missed It: Today during the House Committee on Energy and Commerce #DCCP hearing, I discussed the important work and research being done in my district by Mississippi State University ASSUREuas! Check out the videos below:  https://youtu.be/lDdAzbT0J98 https://youtu.be/-HCIygm-oNA

State Games Opening Ceremony in Meridian cancelled for the 1st time in 26 years due to rain & lightning. Worth the trip to visit with my friend, Danny Dassis, who will soon go to Seattle to compete in Special Olympics. Good luck, Danny!!
Waited out the storm with Lauderdale County Supervisor Josh Todd and the Meridian U-12 Soccer All-Stars Team! Good luck to them in their 8 am game Saturday morning!
Congratulations to Hannah Chisolm: Mississippi Teen USA who came to the Opening Ceremony of the State Games. She is a great ambassador for the State of Mississippi. We're all very proud of her!
Wishing you a blessed weekend as we approach the anniversary of the birth of this great nation.

Watch out Congress! There's a new face on Capitol Hill—and she's not messing around!  • I had a great visit with Anna earlier this week when she and her family visited my office during their trip from Meridian to Washington, and the U.S. Capitol!  • If you or your family are planning a trip to Washington D.C., make sure you go to harper.house.gov so that my office can help you make the most out of your trip to our Nation's Capital!
WATCH, today @HouseCommerce #DCCP passed legislation on #selfdrivingcars which could greatly increase mobility for those with disabilities: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=PyGeihGkGfs
Today I spoke in favor of H.R. 3298 to help the United States Capitol Police officers who have sustained serious injuries in the line of duty.

NEWS: House Energy & Commerce Committee Unanimously Approves Rep. Harper's Drinking Water Bill:  Water is delivered across the country via one million miles of pipes owned by both private and public water systems. Many of these pipes were laid in the early to mid-20th century with a lifespan of 75 to 100 years.   While drinking water quality remains high across the country, improvements can be made. H.R. 3387, the Drinking Water System Improvement Act,  seeks to bring greater investment in the country’s aging drinking water infrastructure as well as facilitate compliance by our drinking water delivery systems.

A BIG thank you to all of our great summer CIPIID interns from the Mason LIFE Program! It has been a blessing getting to know you. Good luck with the fall semester, and I hope we are lucky enough to have you in our offices again! @georgemasonu

As the House begins the process of working to reform our broken tax code, I would love to hear your thoughts on what direction we should be moving in. Click the link below to share with me your opinion and read more about our plan: https://goo.gl/L795K7

Agriculture is Mississippi’s number one industry, with more than 35,000 farms covering over 10 million acres of farmed land. It is clear that Mississippi family farmers are vital to our daily lives, so why then would we impose a tax on these family farmers that could jeopardize their livelihood and cost them the very farms that their family started through hard work and dedication?  MISSISSIPPI FARMERS DESERVE BETTER  The so-called “estate tax,” or Death Tax, is an extremely detrimental part of the current U.S. Tax Code. It puts a burden on these hard-working family farmers and, for many, diminishes their dream of one day passing their farm on to their children. Congress is working on a plan to change that.  We are soon going to submit a plan to remove this tax and restore the American dream to these hard-working farmers and their families. Tax reform means that individual families and small-business owners will be better off, and the U.S. economy will thrive.  CLICK THE PICTURE BELOW TO FIND OUT MORE ABOUT THE REFORMS COMING TO CONGRESS.

Today I took a test drive of Volvo's self-driving car as part of my role as Vice Chair of the  House Committee on Energy and Commerce #SubDCCP. Earlier this month the House passed the Self Drive Act, which is a huge step towards the safe development and deployment of self-driving cars.

This morning I had the honor of speaking to the young leaders of the Meridian Community College's Honors College.

This morning, I joined AT&T Mississippi at their tower site for the launch of Fixed Wireless Internet for Simpson County! In today's world of constant digital communication, access to reliable, fast internet service is vital to so many aspects of our lives—from public safety, health, and education, to the day-to-day operation of business and commerce. This is great news for Simpson County!

This morning, Energy and Commerce held a hearing to discuss federal efforts to combat the opioid crisis. Continuing to find effective ways to fight this epidemic is extremely important. Sadly, it has already affected the lives of so many across the state of Mississippi and our country.

Today, through my role as Chairman of the Committee on House Administration, I held a hearing to discuss the status of voter registration list maintenance conducted by states. The Committee heard from witnesses on how state and local election officials are working to strengthen the accuracy of voter registration lists. Maintaining accurate registration lists increases voter confidence, eases the administration of elections, reduces wait times, and helps prevents voter fraud and irregularity.@houseadmngop

Happy Veterans Day to our veterans who have served and sacrificed for us and our freedoms. Yesterday I spent the day honoring our Mississippi veterans at Rosa Scott High School Veterans Day program in Madison and at the Pearl Veteran’s Day ceremony.

This morning, at 10:00 a.m. ET, I will Chair a hearing of the Committee on House Administration entitled "Preventing Sexual Harassment in the Congressional Workplace."   This is a part of our extensive review of the resources available to assist our Members and staff in regard to sexual harassment awareness and reporting. We need to make certain that the House of Representatives provides the needed sexual harassment awareness training, as well as policies that support a person’s right to report. I thank Speaker Ryan for tasking our Committee with this important review and I look forward to working with everyone to ensure that our Capitol Hill community is a safe and productive work environment.
NA

Washington, D.C.–Today, the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act passed the U.S. House of Representatives. On passage of this historic bill, Congressman Gregg Harper (R-Miss.) released the following statement:  “Today is an exciting day for all Americans, as Republicans in the House bring families one step closer to receiving real relief. The Tax Cuts & Jobs Act will provide more jobs, fairer taxes, and bigger paychecks for hard-working men and women all across the country.”  The Tax Cuts & Jobs Act was written with simple goals in mind:  More Jobs: America has one of the worst tax codes in the industrialized world for businesses. By reducing tax rates for businesses large and small, our bill will level the playing field and make America the jobs magnet of the world.  Fairer Taxes: Our tax code is too complicated. By throwing out special-interest loopholes and consolidating deductions, our bill will make filing taxes so easy that you can use a form as simple as a postcard.  Bigger Paychecks: Americans' taxes are too high, so we are lowering individual tax rates for low- and middle-income Americans and eliminating excessive, costly taxes. That means you get to keep more of your hard-earned paycheck.
